p: Aedes aegypti, Aedes polynesiensis and Aedes albopictus are the potential vectors responsible for the transmission of ZIKV infection by biting. Aedes aegypti is the foremost vector of DENV and CHIKV. Aedes polynesiensis is the main vector responsible for dissemination of lymphatic filariasis in French Polynesia. After the epidemic in French Polynesia these species of mosquitoes were collected and tested for ZIKV infection by RT-PCR and only one Aedes aegypti mosquito was confirmed having ZIKV RNA; experimental investigations showed the French Polynesian strain of Aedes aegypti can replicate the French Polynesian ZIKV strain (Additional file 1: Figure S1) [ 36].
